sub_topic: Population growth models using differential equations
message_1: A certain species of bird starts off with an initial population of 100 birds. The population grows at a rate proportional to the current population, with a doubling time of 3 years. How many birds will be in the population after 6 years?
message_2:
Since the population doubles every 3 years, after 6 years, the population will have doubled twice. 

After the first 3 years, the population will be:
100 birds * 2 = 200 birds

After the next 3 years (total of 6 years), the population will be:
200 birds * 2 = 400 birds

So, after 6 years, there will be 400 birds in the population.
